page.title: 01Landscape of Croft area
page.content: The area that we have been given to survey is mostly rural.Over two thirds of the area is for agricultural use.The nothern part of the area is equally divided for the growing of wheat and rapeseed.The southern part is mostly for cattle pasture and for the growing of silige.Just over one twelth of the area is covered either in disused quarries or the ever expanding E.C.C. Croft Quarry.This is the largest synite quarry in Europe.There are two major transport systems crossing the area the main rail link between Birmingham and Leicester.The second is the main motorway M 69 which links Coventry to Leicester.There are two villages in the area,Croft and the larger Stoney Stanton.The latter village has many disused quarries,the most notorious being Stoney cove.
